result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Chad A. Glick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chad A. Glick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chad A. Glick was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete 24- or 26-week domestic abuse class.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational/treatment programming directed by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

6 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad A. Glick

defendant.name: Glick, Chad A.

records.addlTxt: For Dismissal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Diversion Agreement

Defendant Chad A. Glick in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. McDougal advises the Court that the parties are ready to resolve this matter; def to plead to count 1/false imprisonment and count 1/dc with d.a. element for dispo of 1 year DPA on the false imprisonment and 18 months probation with d.a. class for the dc.  

Court conducts prelim waiver colloquy with def.  Def waives right to prelim.  Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty on count 2; judgment withheld on count 1 for DPA of 18 months year.  Sentence, count 2:  withheld for 18 months probation with conditions of any treatment/education ordered by agent; specifically, d.a. class, court-ordered; costs.

6 days credit in the event of revocation.  DNA sample at jail before probation sign up.

Count 3 dismissed.

Initial appearance at 03-04-2016 02:00 pm

No contact with Emmaleigh Meschke (DOB 03/19/1975). No contact at residence of 21001 County Hwy Q, Richland Center until Ms. McDougal is notified by victim witness coordinator that victim has left the residence.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal appeared by phone means for Defendant Chad A. Glick who appeared via video from Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court will reschedule matter as defense has not had a chance to review the complaint. Atty McDougal requests bond modification. DA objects to modification. Court will amend bond to $1000 cash with same conditions except for the no contact with residence is in effect until defense counsel has been notified by victim witness coordinator that victim has left the residence.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
